Indonectella Hutchison, 1940
: 354 ( type species:
Micronecta thyesta Distant, 1910
, by original designation).

Males: palar claw narrow, straight, and slightly constricted before apex; prestrigilar flap on segment V broadly rounded; strigil absent; median lobe of sternite VII with angular apex, four long setae (see Hutchinson 1940 : pl. V fig. 69); free lobe of tergite VIII subparallel sided, lateral angle acute, posterior margin concave; left paramere styliform, subapical part serrated; right paramere: shaft slender and distally curved (adapted from Hutchinson 1940 ).

Indonectella
is a monotypic subgenus. The type species,
Micronecta thyesta Distant, 1910
, is a junior synonym of
M. grisea ( Fieber, 1844 )
.
